intro: Vernonia gossypina, commonly known as the cottonwood vernonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height, characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and yellow-orange flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its showy inflorescences. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine. The plant is also valued for its ability to thrive in poor soils and its role in supporting local biodiversity.
